answers.answer: I had my first eye exam done yesterday and every thing went well. Since you are pregnant, they will not dilate your eyes. They will do everything else though.
O, and pregnancy may affect your eyes but if you have gestational diabetes then that most def. Will.
Yes it can change you're eyesight. I wouldn't spend the money on it just yet.
I had my eye exam yesterday as well. It's fine to get them checked and the doctor said pregnancy does effect your sight

Yeah. I had an eye exam at four or five months. She pretty much told me that it would be a waste to try getting new glasses until after I deliver because pregnancy does affect eyesight. Luckily she said my eyes weren't affected to much at the time and I didn't need a prescription yet anyway. Now I feel like I do, but still have to wait. She did advise against use of my allergy eye drops though, since they are in the unknown category as far as pregnancy goes. Instead just to use tears over the counter to cleanse the allergens from my eyes as needed.
Ok thanks! Just have a few more weeks until due date so think i will wait

question: I'm due to have my eye exam done. My eyes have been getting worse for years. Should i wait until after the baby is born before i get them checked? Does pregnancy effect my eyesight?
title: Eye exam
